job_title: Senior Data Engineer - Opportunity for Working Remotely Phoenix, AZ
job_Description: Business Summary:     VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 350,000 enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Cloud Era. As a pioneer in the use of virtualization and automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the  Digital Workspace , empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace. Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning, and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join our End User Computing Business Intelligence team as we challenge constraints and solve tomorrow’s problems today!        The VMware End-User Computing runs the world’s largest  Digital Workspace Platform   - Workspace ONE. Our goal is to transform the way customers interact with the digital workspace by providing a platform for data aggregation, reporting, data visualization,  analytics , machine learning, and custom workflows. We are passionate about rapidly developing high-quality software and applying automation and software engineering best practices to everything we do. We work with the latest technologies and open source components. Continuous improvement is part of our DNA. As a member of the Business Intelligence team, you'll have the opportunity to work with highly-skilled, passionate software engineers across Atlanta, Palo Alto, Seattle, and Bangalore. The EUC Business Intelligence vision is to become the central leading-edge innovator of business insights and analytics solutions, a trusted business partner, and industry-recognized for delivery excellence in information and data management. The mission is to help our stakeholders and customers realize the possibility of data analytics to enable growth opportunities.        Our team is seeking a Senior Data Engineer with strong software design and coding skills and broad experience building cloud services, data pipelines, and excellent APIs. You will be interfacing with Customer Success Management, Support, Product Management, and other teams across VMware. You will participate in all the development phases of the EUC Single Source of Truth (SSOT) and dashboards including requirements, design, coding, unit testing, debugging, and performance tuning. Day-to-day activities may include:            Participate in key architecture and design decisions      Own and deliver key product features (generally as part of a team)      Actively contribute to a culture of high ownership, continuous improvement, and engineering excellence      Always be on the lookout for ways to improve our development practices and processes           Job Role and Responsibilities:        We are looking for a Data Engineer to drive business optimization & transformation across the EUC organization. The position responsibilities include the following:            Generate and maintain complex data sets needed for analytics      Design and implement solutions to automatically extract, transform, and load data sets where needed      Create scripts, tools, or other software solutions to help enforce data governance policies      Understand business KPIs and the definitions used in reporting on them      Engineer solutions to resolve the issues in the data sets      Collaborate with Data Analysts to improve data health, quality, and governance      Assist data quality initiatives by engineering solutions to enforce data governance policies      Maintain an understanding of the data creating business processes      Collaborate with other teams to design and implement internal process improvements resulting in higher quality data      Collaborate with Data Analysts to simplify access and reportability of existing data      Create data tools that analysts can use for data visibility needs      Maintain an understanding of the reporting and analytics tools used by the Data Analysts      Support one time needs to extract, transform, and load data sets in existing tools and system           You will have the opportunity to present your work to the leadership team, write or contribute to research papers and participate in industry conferences. You will be encouraged to submit ideas for patent and have the support of our patent team.        Required Skills:         8+ years of experience using Hadoop or Big Data technologies such as Amazon EMR      Experience with object-oriented programming      Experience with data management best practices and disciplines including data governance, data quality, data security, analytics and BI, and data architecture in DAAS and IaaS environment      Experience with gathering requirements from stakeholders      Advanced SQL and database knowledge in a business environment with large-scale complex data sets      Technical knowledge and experience working with relational data modeling, building data pipelines/ETL workflows, and integrating data using APIs      Experience in scripting languages for modifying large data sets like python or SQL      Clear, professional, and concise communications (written/verbal), presentation, and facilitation skills      Able to use a consultative approach and persuasive communication      Works well with complex requirements and minimal supervision      Strong organizational skills and attention to detail        Preferred Skills:         Familiarity with AWS redshift and S3      Solid background in dashboard & report development, business analysis, and requirements gathering      CRM knowledge such as Salesforce, Oracle Sales Cloud, SAP BRIM is a plus      AWS certification is a plus      Experience related to cloud infrastructure, database/platform migration, and dimensional modeling is a plus           Category :  Engineering and Technology   Subcategory:  Software Engineering   Experience:  Manager and Professional   Full Time/ Part Time:  Full Time   Posted Date:  2022-04-01     VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.        Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

job_title: Director of Cyber Metrics & Data Analytics
job_Description: BE PART OF A BANK LIKE NO OTHER.             When you work with the world's most innovative companies, you know you're making a difference.             Our clients are the game changers, leaders and investors who fuel the global innovation economy. They're the businesses behind the next medical breakthroughs. And the visionaries whose new technologies could transform the way people live and work.             They come to SVB for our expertise, deep network and nearly forty years of experience in the industries we serve, and to partner with diverse teams of passionate, enterprising SVBers, dedicated to an inclusive approach to helping them grow and succeed at every stage of their business.             Join us at SVB and be part of bringing our clients' world-changing ideas to life. At SVB, we have the opportunity to grow and collectively make an impact by supporting the innovative clients and communities SVB serves. We pride ourselves in having both a diverse client roster and an equally diverse and inclusive organization. And we work diligently to encourage all with different ways of thinking, different ways of working, and especially those traditionally underrepresented in technology and financial services, to apply.             Job Description             Cybersecurity is an integral part of our SVB culture! As a growing financial institution, it’s vital that we all play our part in keeping customers’ data secure. We’re looking for a cyber professional inherently driven and fascinated by the art and science of cyber defense. We will arm you with the very best tools and tech so that you can deliver top notch results!             As the Director of Cyber Metrics & Data Analytics, you’ll be enthused by the various security sector and data related projects, as well as the chance to work with people from a range of subject areas, and colleagues and clients at every level.             Responsibilities:             Direct the activities of a data science team responsible for the design, development, programming methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured data generating actionable insights for product teams and executive leaders across the enterprise.             Design/build/own a real time data platform that will be leveraged by senior leadership and the Board.             Define the development of software programs, algorithms and automated processes that cleanse, integrate and evaluate large data sets from multiple disparate sources.             Connect the dots to craft compelling, data-driven stories that educate, and provide leadership an understanding of cyber risk at SVB.             Collaborate with Global Security Office team members to collect data and key messages to develop weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting for various audiences.             Quality control metric data to ensure data quality is adequate.             Train associates on reporting requirements, process enhancements, and system improvements to drive organizational maturity and efficiency.             Required Experience:                        Bachelor’s degree preferred                    12 years of work experience with a bachelor’s degree; 10 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters/MBA/JD/MD); or a minimum of 5 years of work experience with a PhD                    A minimum of 7+ years of Cybersecurity, metrics and reporting experience.                    Proficiency in writing SQL queries, Visualization/Business Intelligence tools (i.e. Oracle, Tableau)                    Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, etc.)                    Extensive experience with Model Validation or Development                    Advanced understanding of languages such as R, Python, SAS, SQL, C++ and Matlab                    Experience with Building and Deploying Machine Learning Algorithms                  © 2021 SVB Financial Group. All rights reserved. SVB, SVB FINANCIAL GROUP, SILICON VALLEY BANK, MAKE NEXT HAPPEN NOW and the chevron device are trademarks of SVB Financial Group, used under license. Silicon Valley Bank is a member of the FDIC and the Federal Reserve System. Silicon Valley Bank is the California bank subsidiary of SVB Financial Group (Nasdaq:          SIVB     ).             Equal Employment Opportunity          Silicon Valley Bank is an equal opportunity employer and is dedicated to expanding its commitments and investments to create a more diverse, equitable and inclusive company culture and innovation ecosystem. We are strongly committed to the values and policy of equal employment opportunity across our employment practices.             Silicon Valley Bank is registered in England and Wales at Alphabeta, 14-18 Finsbury Square, London EC2A 1BR, UK under No. FC029579. Silicon Valley Bank is authorised and regulated by the California Department of Business Oversight and the United States Federal Reserve Bank; authorised by the Prudential Regulation Authority with number 577295; and subject to regulation by the Financial Conduct Authority and limited regulation by the Prudential Regulation Authority. Details about the extent of our regulation by the Prudential Regulation Authority are available from us on request.

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. Quality Engineering Solution Architect - QE Innovation and Automation Innovation and automation are at the heart of what we do every day. Our clients can hire anyone to code, test or automate but they choose EY as a strategic partner to create solutions, solve problems and transform how they work. See examples of our work here: Demos of our innovations Discussions on leading technology trends, our patented technology and thought leadership EY’s Next Gen Testing Platform (NGTP) Our purpose statement:  To ask better questions and innovate with technology to transform how testing is done The Opportunity  You have the opportunity to become a thought leader and change agent by applying your technical skill and innovative thinking to build quality engineering solutions and help our clients re-think test design, data management, automation, pipelines and reporting. You must stay on the leading edge of technology and use it to create bespoke solutions to solve problems for our clients. Specifically, your mission will be to be a leader in building our quality engineering practice by partnering with other technology practices to design, build, deploy and customize complex and integrated QE solutions that influence all aspects of software engineering and delivery. You will be expected to listen and understand client needs and create and deliver impactful, innovative solutions. Your Key Responsibilities Everything you’ll do will come back to providing exceptional technical and strategic leadership to our clients and for the growth of our QE Innovation & Automation competency. Colleagues and clients from a diverse array of backgrounds will look to you first for answers, so you’ll be a high-profile contact when it comes to resolving complex issues. As you build your knowledge and experience, you’ll become a credible advisor, influencing clients and engagement teams on resolutions that will impact entire industries. Become a driving force behind the strategy growth of our technical testing capabilities with new and existing clients Create a vision for new QE assets and capabilities leveraging the latest technology trends in test automation, data analytics and performance engineering Design and lead teams to innovate and solve complex problems for our clients to deliver value beyond traditional testing services including using machine learning and other cutting edge technology to lead our clients into the future Work with internal and external parties to develop a deep understanding of our existing and potential capabilities and be able to adapt and apply them to meet the needs of our clients Skills and attributes for success Creating a vision for a solution and leading a team to build it Working with clients to drive transformational change in the way they deliver application testing services in their organizations Inspiring, mentoring and coaching teams members with a goal of fostering an innovative and inclusive team-oriented work environment Sharing your knowledge and developing engagement tools and enablers to build capability for the practice Communicate outcomes and value that are impactful and meaningful to internal or external stakeholders and clients Ability to understand technical concepts and tools, apply them to offer solutions to clients and lead teams to build and deliver those solutions Cultivating business development opportunities and supporting sales To qualify, you must have Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field and approximately 8 years of relevant work experience At least 6 years experience in: Strategy, design and development of technology products, assets and capabilities such as test automation or performance engineering building and inspiring high performing technical teams At least 4 years of experience in leading technical teams At least 3 years of experience in architecting technical solutions Designing and building scalable, innovative solutions for client challenges Defining technical architecture including code structure Working knowledge of Java and coding practices/standards – give technical direction to technical teams, enough to perform code reviews, provide code refactoring recommendations Excellent collaboration and teaming skills in diverse environments Excellent communication and executive presence with executives, business and technical teams Ideally, you’ll also have Approximately 5 years of financial services experience (Capital Markets, Wealth and Investment Management, Banking, Mortgage, Insurance) also including prior consulting experience Relevant industry certification A “go-getter” attitude, passion to constantly learn, improve and perform at the highest level We would expect for you to be available to travel outside of your assigned office location at least 50% of the time, plus commute within the region. Successful candidates must work in excess of standard hours when necessary. A valid passport is required What we look for We’re interested in leaders with a genuine creative vision and the confidence to make it happen. You can expect plenty of autonomy and variety in this role, so you’ll also need the ability to be nimble, take initiative and seek out opportunities to improve our current relationships and prioritize participation in practice initiatives that will generate a long term pipeline of sales for the firm. If you’re serious about progressing and ready to take on some of our clients’ most complex issues, this role is for you. What we offer We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Continuous learning:  You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you:  We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership:  We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture:  You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build. EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today. EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law. EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during the interview process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at ssc.customersupport@ey.com.

At UEI you will be part of a world class team that is working to innovate and revolutionize the meaning of ‘wireless control’. Whether it’s via chips, software licenses or turnkey products, we are continuing to reinvent how consumers interact with devices and services in their home.                      Each day we make the connected home, smarter, easier to connect and use, and way more sustainable. We delight our Fortune 100 customers such as Comcast, Apple, Samsung, Google, Vivint and Daikin with ground breaking wireless technology solutions such as advanced, voice-enabled remote controls, cloud control solutions, extreme low power Bluetooth silicon with energy harvesting capabilities, smart thermostats and sensors and many other IoT solutions.                  As a member of this multi-disciplinary team you will be involved in every aspect of next generation smart home products (ideation, architecture & development, market positioning, etc.). This would require deep understanding of UEI’s core technologies as well as technology trends in smart home, connectivity protocols, IoT software and cloud services. You will always be faced with a new puzzle to solve with current or new technologies with a single goal in mind, an unmatched user experience for our products.                      As a      Principal Technical Program Manager,  you will be responsible for software delivery across teams of engineers covering embedded software, cloud services, and mobile applications, including design, development, test, customer platform integration, and deployment lifecycles. These products include Virtual Assistants, and a whole range of smart home products. A successful candidate will have an established background in developing connected product experiences at scale, in depth knowledge of software development and lifecycle management, strong technical ability in the IoT domain, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment.                      We are all students here, and we do what it takes to achieve the goal. We are looking for a hands-on natural leader to join the fun.                  The duties listed below are intended only as examples of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment to this class.                    Essential Duties and Functions             Work with our strong team of multi-disciplinary geographically distributed developers, data ops and field staff in a fast-paced environment, working side by side and energizing as a whole  Coordinate cross functional development on new technology from design through delivery  Manage and deliver Cloud product releases on time using Agile process in co-ordination with DevOps and Product Owner  Drive the development of tools to process large data sets with statistical algorithms, machine learning and data mining methodologies  Work with remote teams to deliver supporting services and products in sync with launch timelines  Continuously seek innovation in both processes and technologies to reduce operational costs and introduce new customer visible features for our cloud services  Organize backlog of features, epics, stories, and tasks in JIRA  Provides visibility into program health, progress, and impediments by compiling, analyzing, and presenting statistics and other reports using existing tools and/or by introducing new tools                          Skills and Experience             8+ years of experience in a related industry, including hands-on management of large, cross-functional software efforts, preferably with in depth understanding of the smart home / internet of things domain.  Possess a technical background, a hands-on leader and able to learn & apply new topics quickly and efficiently  Superior verbal and written communication skills, and highly comfortable with C-Level interactions  Proven track record of communicating with and managing strong multi-disciplinary geographically distributed teams in a fast-paced environment, handling technical and operational challenges for growth  Competency in software development methodologies in embedded systems, cloud platforms, cloud development, and data infrastructure  Experience in developing and managing data driven products  Experience with high availability large scale cloud platform, modern data architectures, DevOps  Familiar with continuous integration and build management tools such as Jenkins  Experience building processes, project management, and release schedules  Must be able to assess scope and define timelines, plans, and roadmap  Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment  Prior experience in Microsoft technology stack including Azure, .Net, SQL Server and other common cloud technologies is highly preferred  Prior experiences in embedded applications, web technologies, mobile application development, or data infrastructure development                          Education             B.S. degree in Computer Science or related technical field, graduate degree preferred                         Universal Electronics Inc. (NASDAQ: UEIC) is the worldwide leader in universal control and sensing technologies for the smart home. Its broad portfolio of patents includes QuickSet® software that utilizes the world’s most complete knowledge graph to detect and interact with thousands of entertainment and smart home devices. The company designs, develops, and manufactures innovative products that are used by the world’s leading brands in the audio, video, subscription broadcasting, connected home, home energy management, and mobile device markets. UEI’s many first-to-market innovations have helped transform the home entertainment control, home security, and home energy management and sensing industries.                  Universal Electronics Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer. We are proud of our diverse workforce and we believe having diverse teams that everyone brings their whole self to work everyday is key to all of our success. We welcome all people of different experiences, backgrounds, perspectives and abilities.

At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way. As a member of our team, you can too.     We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components:  Client. Team. Win. Innovate.           We actively look for prospects who:              Are passionate about client success.      Enjoy collaborating with others.      Strive to exceed expectations.      Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutions.               Job Description:        You are:     A Self-motivated Contributor who can design and build datasets that solve business problems. You are a Determined team player who can use data to predict and influence customer behaviors to meet organizational objectives.        You will:         Contribute to the creation of a new analytics team serving all facets of the Financial Services business, with a focus on data governance      Develop and operationalize data management and benchmarking, including data normalization, cleaning, and mapping of data into a normalized structure      Develop models in support of sales enablement, revenue forecasting and portfolio management      Develop, support, and deliver business review documents on a regular cadence      Create and publish reporting and dashboards, anticipating relevant questions and analysis      Comfortable explaining analysis to a non-technical audience, understanding and translating operational challenges to achieve data led solutions. Can build and present data in a consumable manner (presentations, dashboards) that answer business questions           Your background:        As a Data Scientist,  you have:         Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Data Analytics, a related quantitative discipline      Experience with statistical modelling and analytical techniques & working with Python, SQL, and R      2+ years' experience working in a Data Science/Data Analysis/Statistics role in a commercial or consumer financial environment      Statistical techniques such as linear/logistic regression, clustering, decision trees, time series analysis, machine learning, A/B tests, GLM, Bayesian Methods)      Experience with data, including querying, aggregation, analysis, and visualization is a benefit           Desirable:         Experience in a Financial Services or Commercial Bank      Masters or PhD in related field      Experience with rate making and financial forecasting      Experience with Snowflake, SAP HANA           We will:           Provide the opportunity to grow and develop your career     Offer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspectives and ideas     Deliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of a transforming organization     Offer comprehensive benefits globally  ( pbprojectliving.com)           Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace. SCIENTIFIC PROGRAMMER AND EDUCATOR                                     Posting Number                    req8094                                    Department                    Communications & Cyber Tech                                    Department Website Link                    https://cals.arizona.edu/                                    Location                    Main Campus                                    Address                    Tucson, AZ USA                                    Position Highlights                    The Data Science Institute and the University of Arizona College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Data Science team have two openings for a scientific software engineer and educator. The ideal candidate is either a domain scientist with software and programming experience or a software engineer with experience applying computational and statistical methods to support scientific research.         The incumbents will split time between providing support on research projects and offering training across campus. With multiple openings, we are hoping to find two with complimentary experience and skills.          The education component of the position will develop, enhance and expand the Data Science Institute’s capabilities to develop curriculum and provide just-in-time training, workshops, consultation and support for students, faculty and staff wanting to learn foundational tools and concepts of data science and reproducible computational science. This will include broad collaboration across the data science community, including with other campus partners and trainers related to computational science and data science.          The research component of the position will directly support research projects across the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, Cooperative Extension, and Experiment Station. They will be expected to conduct and communicate reproducible research, data management, and analysis.         Outstanding UA benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ASU/NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; state and optional retirement plans; access to UA recreation and cultural activities; and more!         The University of Arizona has been recognized for our innovative work-life programs. For more information about working at the University of Arizona and relocations services, please  click here .                                           Duties & Responsibilities                     The positions will be split approximately 50:50 between research and education.     Building computational and data science capacity:                Develop and deliver workshops and related training materials on computational science and data science. Workshop topics may include but are not limited to computational notebooks, tools for reproducible computing, statistics, remote sensing, machine learning, visualization, and data management.         Work with campus partners and other trainers in delivery of workshops and training materials related to data science.          Participate with and offer trainings for programs such as the Data Science Ambassadors, Roots for Resilience Graduate Fellowship and the Data Science Fellows programs.         Use and follow best practices in developing training materials, scientific computing, data and code management, documentation and digital forms of communication.                Research                Enable research in the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, Cooperative Extension, and Experiment Station.         Develop and lead 'incubator' projects with researchers across campus.         Provide computational, statistical, and domain expertise for larger, externally funded projects. Possible scientific domain knowledge include: earth and environmental sciences, agriculture, or ecophysiology.         The incumbent will have flexibility to work on a variety of other projects across the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, Experiment Station, and Cooperative Extension. You can learn more about our group at datascience.cals.arizona.edu.                Outreach                         Engage and interact with campus collaborators and related professional organizations; represent the Data Science Institute at workshops, meetings and conferences.          Contribute to University of Arizona data science community events such as Coffee & Code, Hacky Hour, Women in Data Science, RezBaz, and Machine Learning Literacy Project events.                           General Duties:                                Develop analytical pipelines          Work with researchers to enable new computational methods          Meet regularly with group members and collaborators          Work in an iterative, agile environment                           Examples of Project Responsibilities :                      Run ecological models using the PEcAn framework         Develop reproducible analyses and scalable workflows         Develop and apply statistical models         Develop, refactor, test, and document scientific R packages, Python libraries         Create and improve visualizations and interpretation of results         Curate and manage data          Develop APIs, Dashboards, and other custom software                                                   Minimum Qualifications                    Master’s degree required.                Experience in scientific software development.                Proficiency in R or Python.                Experience with version control         Experience with cloud and / or cluster computing.                Experience teaching computational skills.                Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team.                                     Preferred Qualifications                     PhD in a related field. Experience with Bayesian analysis, data management, scientific publishing, project management, containers, testing, remote sensing, R package, or Python library development.         Possible scientific domain knowledge include: earth and environmental sciences, agriculture, or ecophysiology. job_title: Professional Services Regional Practice Architect, Security
job_Description: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!     Splunk is the world’s first Data-to-Everything Platform. Now organizations no longer need to worry about where their data is coming from, and they are free to focus on the business outcomes that data can deliver.     Role:     Are you looking to make an impact? The work you’ll do will directly impact the experience of our customers. We bring best practices out to the world to make people happier with our software, and just as importantly, we bring the world's needs and wants back to Splunk to make our software better. You will get the chance to see firsthand the phenomenal things that our customers and partners do with Splunk.     About You:  You are passionate about security, understand risk management and have experience designing and building solutions that help business partners to make informed decisions. The ability to simplify and communicate complex technical ideas to broad audiences has been a key to your success. You are self-motivated at work, and in making time investments to learn about new technologies, methods and approaches in the security landscape.     About the Role:  As a Global Services Regional Practice Architect, you will ensure enterprise deployments make the deepest impact possible for our customers. You'll tackle an organizations’ most challenging problems, including the ones they didn't know existed. Regional Practice Architects are adept at mastering new technologies and come from a variety of business, analytics and technology backgrounds. They are eager to share their knowledge with others through formal and informal mentoring activities. Of paramount importance is the ability to be a great teammate and work well with others towards common goals.     Responsibilities:         Deliver compelling messages articulating Splunk’s value proposition to executive leadership in current and prospective Splunk customer accounts.      Defend the necessity of a Splunk Security investment to customer VP and CxO leadership based upon risk, allocation of resources, tools/people spend, and proprietary vs open-source approaches.      Provide collaborative communications and customer partnership that allows customers to feel valued, heard and supported.      Assess customer security programs to include operational and Governance, Risk and Compliance capabilities to measure threat detection/analysis, mitigation, remediation and recovery capabilities.      Advise customers on industry best practices regarding the use of threat intelligence, event investigations, incident management and investigations, vulnerability management, asset management, and preventive security controls.      Advise on the incorporation of Threat Intelligence, Machine Learning, SOAR, and Behavioral Analytics technologies for successful customer outcomes.      Perform just-in-time knowledge acquisition in order to deliver training to customer and partner teams and end users on advancing technologies.      Mentor and coach junior Splunk and partner consultants in new knowledge and process areas, in security methodology, technology, consultancy, in non-technical areas.      Create relevant materials for field teams focused on new product features, domain trends, and other deep technical content.      Interact with customers and prospects to understand their business challenges and desired outcomes.      Partner with field leadership to jointly develop strategic and technical account plans.      Represent the Global Security Practice to understand current and future product developments, to communicate to the field, as well as contribute to future development direction based upon customer needs and your security expertise.      Support Global Security Practice initiatives, such as service offerings development and support product interlock.      In partnership with your manager, develop and supervise appropriate performance goals and metrics.      Deliver presentations and technical briefings to customers on Splunk premium products and solutions. Assist and lead with critical Splunk evaluations and POC’s.      Deliver on paid customer subscriptions (Assigned Expert, On-Demand Services, etc).      Acquire and maintain senior level Splunk Security certifications.        Requirements:         5+ years of experience in technically delivering and supporting security software products to a range of customers      5+ years as a security analyst, security engineer, security researcher, or other hands-on security role      Development proficiency in at least 1 of the following programming languages: Java, .NET, PHP, Ruby, Python, Node.JS, Objective-C, Java-Dalvik      Experience with Unix or Linux based scripting languages (Perl, Python, Bash)      Experience working with Terraform, Kubernetes or Docker      Experience working with microservices in cloud environments such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure      Significant experience delivering executive and customer presentations      3+ years’ experience with *nix, macOS, Windows administration      2+ years’ experience in a team or project leadership role      Demonstrated communication skills – written and oral. Ability to communicate complex ideas and a clear and concise way      Conference/meetup presentations      Security Blog contributions      Training content development      Knowledge of compliance and risk management requirements from government, financial, and/or health care customers and how requirements impact system design, services capabilities, and what drives customers decisions      Demonstrated experience deploying Splunk technology to customer environments      Unix/Linux and Windows administration, patching and configuration expertise      Experience with networking, server, application, virtualization, big data, and web technologies      Ability to work with diverse groups of people; challenge and lead people toward their peak performance      Domain expertise with security operations or compliance      Experience with the Splunk Security product portfolio      Experience with US Federal programs and compliance requirements such as the NIST RMF and the ATO process preferred      Able to travel up to 75%        We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.     For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

About Us :        At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, fresh thinking and possibilities are forged in times of change and you will be on the front lines as we trail blaze new approaches, push the boundaries of innovation, and chart a course to a tomorrow you can be proud to have a hand in creating        Job Summary :        As the  Signal Processing Engineering Fellow , you will participate in unique multi-disciplinary research across integrated product teams consisting of Guidance, Navigation and Control (GNC), Signal Processing and missile-and-sensor-level Performance Simulations. You will perform critical radar and/or electro-optic/infrared (EO/IR) system trades, resolving complex signal processing problems, and advising program and engineering management teams in pursuit of organizational business targets. Signal Processing Fellows are demonstrated industry experts, versatile, innovative, and eager to share their knowledge.        Responsibilities to Anticipate:            You will apply knowledge of algorithm development in areas such as detection and estimation, clutter rejection, feature extraction, classification, tracking, and sensor fusion      You will mentor others in the development of technical solutions to complex signal processing problems that require application of advanced technical principles involving multiple subsystem interactions; and guide the successful completion of signal processing development and integration efforts in a technical expert capacity      You will act independently, as well as working with early career engineers, to uncover and resolve issues associated with development and implementation of radar and/or EO/IR system designs      You will collaborate across programs; representing the organization as a subject matter expert within the field of signal processing; and      You will interact with senior managers to plan and execute programs to accomplish long-range objectives, while also helping to shape the strategic direction of technology to accomplish long-term goals      You will oversee a technical team, mentor engineers, and/or manage engineering projects           Qualifications You Must Have:            Bachelor’s Degree in engineering disciplines, natural or physical sciences, Mathematics, or Physics      With a Bachelor’s Degree listed above, you must have twelve (12) years or more of documented work experience designing, implementing, and testing radar and/or EO/IR signal processing algorithms in areas such as detection and estimation, clutter rejection, feature extraction, classification, tracking, or sensor fusion (A Master’s Degree will satisfy 2 years of work experience and a PhD will satisfy 4 years of work experience)      At least eight (8+) years of documented experience with systems engineering of radar and/or EO/IR systems, including system-level requirements allocation, participation in design reviews or peer reviews, and presenting technical briefings to both internal and external customers      Documented experience successfully procuring research and development funding both internal and external to the company      Documented experience using C++ and MATLAB.      Must be the author of intellectual property (patent disclosures) or conference/journal publications in a signal processing technical area within the past ten (10) years.      The ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance prior to the start date. U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance           Qualifications We Value:            Masters or Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Physics, or Mathematics      Experience assessing radar and/or EO/IR sensor system integration risks through laboratory, ground, and flight test data evaluation      Experience with radar characteristics in the presence of plasma      System-level design experience across multiple engineering disciplines such as software, electrical, mechanical, and test engineering      Broad experience in disciplines adjacent to signal processing, including modeling and simulation; guidance, navigation, and control; embedded software development; and hardware in the loop testing      Experience with proposal preparation to obtain new business contracts, spanning technical proposal development, work breakdown structures, and cost estimation      Experience in autonomous and collaborative systems, hypersonics, calibration of radar and/or EO/IR sensors, or Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning      Experience influencing large, multi-discipline teams as a Chief Engineer      Recognized as a subject matter expert within the industry, with prior defense contractor businesses, and among the customer base      Experience with missile components and systems      DoD Top Secret clearance with current SSBI within last 5 years           What We Offer :        Whether you are just starting out on your career journey, or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package including compensation, healthcare, wellness, retirement, work/life benefits, career development and recognition programs. Some of the best benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance, and child/adult backup care.        Employee Referral Award Eligibility :     Only employees currently within  RMD and RI&S  have the potential to receive a Referral Award for submitting a referral to RMD and RI&S roles. ALL eligibility requirements must be met to receive the Referral Awarding.

Overview      Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard, as well as ProConnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and Streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.      Frontdoor is looking for an Account Manager to join our team! In this role, you will be responsible for growing FTDR’s sales, developing long-term relationships with a portfolio of clients, and connecting with key business executives and stakeholders. You will identify, analyze and help the team grow in your location. Also, the Account Manager does the following:      Grow sales volume with existing accounts while driving to acquire new relationships and customers.      Develop business relationships with the real estate community through one-on-ones, group presentations and respond to their sales inquiries and service needs.      Leverages and analyzes data to gain deep understanding of local market, identify opportunities and continually develop and implement strategies/tactics to grow existing business.      Partners with team members to build business plans and deliver quarterly reviews to customers.      Partner with your Business Development Manager to ensure adherence to agreements with external partners, including reporting, communication, and service levels.      Works with Regional/Divisional teams to highlight specific geographic opportunities and makes recommendations for resolutions.        Position Location:  Phoenix, Arizona      Responsibilities        You are a great candidate for this role if you:    Desire to work in a team environment where we leave egos at the door.      Enjoy learning new concepts and pursuing new opportunities.      Are a self-starter, personable and can develop relationships that create sales.      Can juggle multiple priorities and make things happen in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.      Are a solution driven individual.      Possess great presentation skills and are comfortable in front of an audience.      Obsess about customers and are driven to do great things every day.      Display digital dexterity.      Want to work in a fun, fast-paced sales environment.      Qualifications      1-3 years sales or related work experience preferred.      Ability to sell in person or virtually.      Proficient time management skills.      Strong interpersonal and presentation skills.      Effective problem solver.      \#INCSC      Need help finding the right job?      We can recommend jobs specifically for you!      Job Locations US-AZ-Phoenix | US-AZ-Phoenix      ID 2022-2763      Category Sales      Type Full Time      Company AHS American Home Shield Corp

job_title: Senior Consultant, Senior Paid Social Media Buyer
job_Description: Position Summary         In today's world, customers expect companies to know who they are and what they want. Customers want to have products, services, or experiences that best suit their needs delivered to them seamlessly across physical and digital channels. Customers are human first: driven by dynamic wants, needs, and desires. The ability for brands to make personal, meaningful connections on a human level has never been greater and the Experience Management team at Deloitte Digital delivers on those experiences in a way that allows companies to own the customer journey end-to-end.         We help companies connect key data sources to understand what matters most to people; connect to advanced technologies like AI and machine learning to sense and respond to those needs at scale; and connect their systems to unlock insights, create collaboration and drive acquisition, engagement, and loyalty. Most importantly, we empower companies to connect with customers in personal, meaningful ways that respect them as people, not just customers.        The Experience Management team at Deloitte Digital gives companies the ability to build and leverage the connections - between people, systems, data, and technologies - so they can deliver personalized, contextual experiences to customers at scale. We are seeking to transform the way brands interact with their customers and elevate the human experience. Do you have data in your DNA? Join our growing team in supporting our clients' ability to communicate the right message to the right customers at the right time.           The Work You'll do         We are seeking a strong candidate that is passionate about social paid media, teamwork, process improvement, and driving results for clients. Attention to detail, positive energy, and a willingness to learn should be engrained in your DNA. You have a knack for digging into data and problem-solving your way to ROAS positive campaigns.        The Senior Paid Social Media Buyer will work across Deloitte Digital Clients, report to the Head of Ad Performance, and work as part of our Paid Media team. This person will be responsible for building and optimizing Facebook, LinkedIn, Pinterest, TikTok, and other paid social campaigns with the goal of achieving, and in many cases, exceeding clients' objectives and KPIs. The ideal candidate has a strong paid social planning, buying, and analysis background with experience executing/buying on social platforms. Additionally, you are looking to help mentor and up-level members of your team.            Build, manage and optimize paid social media campaigns through a variety of social platforms, specifically Facebook Ads Manager, TikTok, and YouTube (Pinterest and LinkedIn are a plus)      Develop paid social strategy to meet and exceed client's KPIs.      Utilize reporting to measure, evaluate, and analyze paid social campaign performance to determine campaign success and provide recommendations and optimizations on an ongoing basis.      Actively test and analyze targeting, ad creative, landing pages, and placements to drive results      Manage and pace campaign budgets on a routine basis to ensure efficient delivery of advertising spend and to ensure clients are pacing towards campaign objectives and goals      Work cross-functionally to align campaign strategies and goals across the paid media team in an effort to create more collaboration and ensure a holistic paid media approach and strategy      Create and present quarterly business reviews & other client-facing presentations that outline performance, insights from testing, and key strategic opportunities      Measure impact and effectiveness of campaigns and share results and insights with the paid media director and client contact      Stay current on paid social industry trends and emerging platforms      Delegate work to a paid social analyst who will support you on the account            The team         Advertising, Marketing & Commerce         Our Advertising, Marketing & Commerce team focuses on delivering marketing and growth objectives aligned with our clients' brand values for measurable business growth. We do this by creating content, communications, and experiences that engage and inspire their customers to act. We implement and operate the technology platforms that enable personalized content, commerce, and marketing user-centric experiences. In doing so, we transform our clients' marketing and engagement operations into modern, data-driven, creatively focused organizations. Our team brings deep experience in creative and digital marketing capabilities, many from our Digital Studios.        We serve our clients through the following types of work:            Omnichannel customer engagement strategy, design, and development (web, mobile, social, physical)      eCommerce strategy, implementation, and operations      Marketing Content and digital asset management solutions      Marketing Technology and Advertising Technology solutions      Marketing analytics implementation and operations      Advertising campaign ideation, development, and execution      Acquisition and engagement campaign ideation, development, and execution      Agile based, design-thinking, user-centric, empirical projects that accelerate results            Required Qualifications             4+ years of experience in paid social media buying and analysis      Experience in Facebook Ads Manager      In-depth knowledge of social media content requirements, restrictions, and best practices by platform - includes buying, optimizing, and reporting practices      Able to review results and performance of paid media campaigns based on predetermined success indicators, determine the effectiveness and report back to clients      Must be organized and able to work under multiple deadlines      Ability to collaborate in a team environment with a demonstrated ability to assist where needed      Willingness to dive in and find answers to complex problems where solutions may not yet be documented      Strong interpersonal and communication skills      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills      Initiative, detail orientation, strong analytical and decision-making skills      Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications      Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree      Travel up to 30% (while 30% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice)      Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship now or at any time in the future            Preferred Qualifications             Facebook Blueprint certifications in Media Planning, Buying, etc.      Experience in the women's retail industry      Advertising Agency experience        AMC2021        XMAMC2022

PwC Labs is focused on standardizing, automating, delivering tools and processes and exploring emerging technologies that drive efficiency and enable our people to reimagine the possible. Process improvement, transformation, effective use of innovative technology and data & analytics, and leveraging alternative delivery solutions are key areas of focus to drive additional value for our firm. The AI Lab focuses on implementing solutions that impact efficiency and effectiveness of our technology functions. Process improvement, transformation, effective use of technology and data & analytics, and leveraging alternative delivery are key areas to drive value and continue to be recognized as the leading professional services firm. AI Lab is focused on identifying and prioritizing emerging technologies to get the most out of our investments. To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future. As a Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to: Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas. Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results. Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems. Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends. Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance. Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice. Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives. Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others. Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships. Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct. Job Requirements and Preferences :   Basic Qualifications :   Minimum Degree Required : Bachelor Degree   Additional Educational Requirements : In lieu of a Bachelor Degree, 12 years of professional experience involving technology-focused process improvements, transformations, and/or system implementations Minimum Years of Experience : 2 year(s)   Preferred Qualifications :   Degree Preferred : Master Degree   Preferred Fields of Study : Computer and Information Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Artificial Intelligence and Robotics, Statistics, Data Processing/Analytics/Science   Preferred Knowledge/Skills : Demonstrates thorough abilities and/or a proven record of success as a team leader in the following areas: Evaluating new technologies to quickly determine their long term viability within PwCs enterprise wide technology stack, serving 50k+ professionals; Understanding a business problem and being able to translate the problem into a hypothesis that can be tested using various data science techniques; Conducting research in a lab environment and publishing work through AI institutes and journals; Demonstrating thorough understanding of complex machine learning algorithms, data analysis techniques, and data science tools, to address a variety of challenging business problems in the areas of natural language understanding, computer vision, and unsupervised learning; Building a variety of machine learning models and more importantly, knowing when and why it is appropriate to use each technique: KNN, Logistic Regression, Naive Bayes, Random Forests, Support Vector Machines, XGBoost, Deep Neural Networks, K-means and Hierarchical Clustering, etc.; Building machine learning models, data pipelines, and autonomous systems, interpreting their output, and communicating the results to a non technical audience; and, Performing DevOps/engineering tasks in publishing and deploying AI assets in live production environments suitable for large scale adoption for 55k+ professionals throughout the US. Demonstrates thorough abilities and/or a proven record of success with a subset of the following technologies: Programming including Python, R, Java, JavaScript, C++, Unix Hardware, sensors, robotics, GPU enabled machine learning, FPGAs, and Raspberry Pis, etc.; Data Storage Technologies including SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, cloud-based databases such as GCP BigQuery, and different storage formats (e.g. Parquet, etc.); Data Processing Tools including Python (Numpy, Pandas, etc.), Spark, and cloud-based solutions such as GCP DataFlow; Machine Learning Libraries including Python (scikit-learn, gensim, etc.), TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Spark MLlib; NLP and text extraction techniques including document topic analysis, document clustering and classification, named entity extraction/resolution, creating word/sentence embeddings (numerical vector representations), sentiment analysis etc.; Visualization including Python (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, bokeh, etc.), and JavaScript (d3); and, Code management, model productionization and containerization technologies including GitHub, Flask, Docker, and Kubernetes. job_title: Senior Product Manager - Data Insights - Remote
job_Description: Skilljar is seeking an expert Senior Product Manager in Data / Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning to join our fast-growing product team. Founded in Seattle WA, Skilljar is now operating remote with employees (affectionately called Skillets) based across the United States. This is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly growing Series B company with Fortune 1000 and mid-market customers! Our customers have educated 4M+ users and conducted 100M+ online lessons in self-paced and virtual live sessions.  Our Mission  We believe that education is the key to unlocking product innovations' benefits for individuals, organizations, and society. Our journey started when our co-founders - Sandi and Jason - saw that companies were developing products with phenomenal potential, but users were struggling to put these products to work. Product education was the missing link and legacy tools were frustrated users.  We've built the best customer education platform in the world. Asana, Cisco, Intercom, LinkedIn, Slack, Liberty Mutual, Qualtrics, Tableau, U-Haul, Verizon, Zenefits, and hundreds of companies across industries use Skilljar to accelerate product adoption and increase user retention at scale. We are backed by top-tier investors, including Insight Partners, Mayfield, Shasta Ventures, and Trilogy Equity Partners. Our customers rave about us because we are passionate about helping them transform their users into product specialists and evangelists.  Responsibilities  Develop and lead a data insight vision, strategy, and roadmap for products that drive customer education outcomes. Use data-science tools, while considering customer and market feedback, competitive analysis, and business goals.  Work would include recommendations, search & discovery, content suggestions, and personalization done in standard natural language technologies  Drive execution on the roadmap with full product development process. Lead research, definition, success metrics, experimentation plans, releases, GTM and post-launch continuous improvement.  Innovate in a collaborative environment with a focus on rapid time to market. Focus on quality products and be on top of the latest developments that are relevant for Skilljar products.  Requirements  5+ years of product management experience, preferably in enterprise SaaS products  2+ years of data background and hands-on experience in one or more of data science, AI/ML & analytics  Bachelor's degree required. BS or higher degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or other technical field is strongly preferred but not required.  Passion for products and technology – loves to innovate and tackle sophisticated problems  Highly accountable individual, who shows genuine care about people, processes, and technology.  Excellent skills in verbal & written communication and presentations to internal and external audiences.  Our Benefits  Comprehensive Medical Coverage: Skilljar pays 100% of our employee premiums for medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. (PTO and family leave)  Flexible Time Off: We believe in a healthy work/life balance and trust our employees to take the time off they need to bring their A-game to work.  Benefits Package: Skilljar employees receive a monthly technology reimbursement for remote work, 401K savings plan, stock options, and access to an Employee Assistance Program.  Inclusive Culture: We are intentional about creating a culture that is fun and inclusive. Join us for Fun Committee events, trivia nights, Bingo, and more!  The Company   Backed by prominent financial institutions, including Mayfield, Shasta Ventures, and Trilogy Equity Partners, Skilljar is the leading enterprise customer training platform, transforming the way organizations onboard, engage, and retain their customers. Trusted by leading global companies like Zillow, Slack, Tableau, Liberty Mutual, Cisco, Verizon, and U-Haul, Skilljar provides the essential tools and foundation for successful customer and partner engagement and enablement.  We are a team of bright, dedicated Skillets with startup drive and a passion for education. Headquartered in Seattle, WA, Skilljar is currently operating remotely, with employees based in Washington, Oregon, California, Colorado, Utah, Idaho, Texas, Arizona, Georgia, North Carolina and Florida.    Skilljar is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act) with respect to employment opportunities.   Skilljar does not accept nor are we responsible for any fees associated with unsolicited resumes, LinkedIn bios, or any other candidate introductions.

Do you want to make a difference and help save lives? We at Defendry are on a mission to address the current active shooter epidemic by doing what we do best — creating tech solutions. We’re searching for people who share our same passion.  You will be joining a fast-paced, dynamic environment and product team, working with top talent in the fields of Data Science / Machine Learning, Cloud Computing, App Development and Integration (IoT, Drones, Security Systems).  We are expanding our product team across all facets of the Defendry tech stack, which includes:   Edge technology installed at schools, businesses, churches, etc. where we use Artificial Intelligence to monitor security camera feeds and detect threats. We also use sensors to “listen” for threats.  A cloud environment for registering edge computers and devices, remotely distributing software, monitoring health of edge devices.  Cloud services and web applications for managing customers, customer locations, and partners.  Integration services between the Defendry Cloud and customer or government mass notification systems, as well as top Security Monitoring companies, where we put detected threats in front of a trained agent, and ultimately the proper emergency response team.  Building/enhancing mobile application(s) that provide incident notifications, allows people to report potential threats, and aid for first responders.   A successful candidate will have:   5+ years of relevant experience in building production software products in more than one programming language  Strong analytical and problem solving skills  Experience in building large scale distributed systems  Extensive knowledge of data structures, design, algorithms, and coding   Experience with one or more of the following is a plus:   Open source frameworks – especially maintaining or contributing to open source projects!  Relational and NoSQL databases, including PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, redis, Couchbase, or Cassandra.  Designing and developing REST (or even better, gRPC) APIs for high volume clients.  Using continuous integration tools (Jenkins, Gitlab CI).  Managing container and container orchestration technologies, such as Docker and Kubernetes.  Machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and Caffe.  Front-end or mobile development with React / Redux, JavaScript  Azure (preferred) and/or AWS/Google cloud resource management and distribution  Controlling or monitoring IoT devices and/or drones

This is a highly organized individual to work on our Automated Intelliglence Coding Solultion, for multiple specialties and platforms within TES. Responsible for planning and management of AI Coding Solution testing activities including functional, system integration, database and operational testing. Identifies, reports and manages defects through resolution.      Tracks testing progress and provides accurate testing status to leadership and project team(s)      Works with project team to identify problems or deficiencies in the software development process with a goal of process improvement.      Acts as an advocate for the end user experience.      Works in a team environment, where collaboration is required to ensure the team success in delivering new functionalities to customers per business requirements.      Manage day to day activities, meetings, etc with AI Team, AI Leadership, Operational Staff, Coding Managers, IT / Support teams and AI Quality Assurance team.               What are the requirements needed for this position?               Years of experience:  10+ years experience       Education : BS in Management Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent experience      Physical requirements:  General office demands  What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?                8+ years in the field of project and program management experience and leadership      Prior experience leading/managing testing projects      Previous experience with Agile software development.      Familiarity with the Microsoft Office suite including Access and Visio, Aha!      Proficient in SQL and Excel      Excellent verbal and written communication skills      Experience writing, managing and executing end to end test plans and test cases      Analytical and problem-solving skills        What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?         Prior experience working with EDI      Prior experience with HL7 and interfacing between platforms      Detail oriented, self-starter and a team player      Ability to follow a project schedule, juggling tasks and priorities to meet rapidly changing deadlines      Ability to prioritize tasks within the project and work with minimal supervision      Ability to work and deliver in an agile environment supporting multiple teams      Knowledge of Microsoft Project.      Passion for quality assurance of end-user applications.      Prior experience with automation testing a plus           What are the working conditions and physical requirements of this job?
